reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This B&B was such a treat. The place was not the easiest to find, but when we did - we were delighted and had a great experience. It's a beautiful property and perfectly situated for local touring. The room was cozy and clean. It even had a little balcony to walk out on. The staff was extremely accommodating and helpful giving information about local sites (providing maps and suggestions). We had a delicious breakfast that had good variety.
reviews.title: Exceptionally Quaint!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This very new B&B, only a few years old, is very lovely. The man who owns the hotel was very nice. When we had to depart early our last morning, he laid out everything for us in advance and basically let us help ourselves to the kitchen. The room was beautiful and comfortable. It's a little difficult to locate, so take the time to write ahead for directions which we forgot to do. But once we located the road, it was easy to find. The parking is secure, but is on a slope.
reviews.title: Exceptional service, lovely B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had the nicest stay here. The B & B is virtually brand new and just gorgeous. With amazing views from the room, balconies and garden. The owner & his staff are extremely nice and very helpful. The room was large & gorgeous, as was the bathroom. The bed were very comfortable too. Extremely clean and beautifully decorated rooms. The location is good, with a very short, but steep walk up to town. But you can also park at the hotel for free or if you didn't want to walk up to the old Orvieto the car park to the town is not far away either. The breakfast was amazing, with so many tarts & cakes to choose from, but also there was yoghurt, fruit, cold meats & cheese etc. We really loved our stay and look forward to coming back. Can highly recommend.
reviews.title: Best B & B in Orvieto

reviews.text: We arrived early and were graciously welcomed and offered coffee.
reviews.title: Amazing hosts! A wonderful B &B!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were considering dropping our rental car in Orvieto rather than drive into Rome the next morning. Our host made a call to make sure this would be okay. Our room was spacious and attractively decorated. Breakfast was wonderful with an excellent variety. Our host insisted he drive us to the train station after breakfast to take the train to Rome. We highly recommend this B&B!
reviews.title: I love!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from this B&B yesterday. The reviews are all correct, it's fabulous. You will be so happy that you chose this accommodation. Lovely building, large spotless room with everything you need and right at the base of the hill of Orvieto. You can come and go as you please with your entry card, the hosts are always available if needed. One night we came back from driving around Tuscany and wanted to view the underground caves. Daniele told us to hop in his car so he could drive us up there as we wouldn't make the last tour in time. We made it with minutes to spare and really appreciated that. He also gave fabulous recommendations on where to go sightseeing in the area. Breakfast is yogurt, hard boiled eggs, cheese/meat plate, croissants, pastries, cereal, juice, coffee, tea. The chocolate coconut cake was my fave but I did feel guilty eating it at 8:00 in the morning! We LOVED our 3 nights here and give this a five star. Excellent and you can't go wrong.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience
A great B&B!!
reviews.text: New, spotless, beautifully furnished and thoughtfully supplied - this is simply a great B&B. Our room was large as was the bathroom with plenty of space to put bags etc. we had a lovely view of the hills. The location is perfect at the foot of the walls. You can walk or drive to the elevator which takes you straight up to the city. There is wifi and the breakfast is very well supplied with a good variety. The owners could not have been more helpful and everyday the room was refreshed. Absolutely 5 star and so much better than a hotel. Great value and top quality.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the pleasure of staying at Villa degli Ulivi on 26th September 2012, encouraged by the excellent reviews on TripAdvisor. We can therefore verify that this is an excellent B&B. Host Daniele has clearly made a great investment in his B&B, both in the fabric of the building and in consideration of guests' needs.
reviews.title: Outstanding.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean and attractive, the view from the outside dining area is very pleasant as per the photographs. Breakfast was lavish compared to other B&Bs we have stayed at with a wonderful spread of pastries, meats etc.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most important of all though was Daniele's attitude. He understands visitors needs and was very helpful and courteous. We didn't feel rushed at any point.
reviews.title: The reviews do not lie

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Orvieto, Italy was the last stop on a three and a half week trip to Italy. It was also the most memorable stop due to the hospitality and many kindnesses of Daniele and the staff of the Villa degli Ulivi. We spent part of the time in Room 201 a with a wonderful terrace overlooking the Umbrian countryside. Very clean with three beds and several windows looking out to the surrounding area. The room also contains many nice personal touches as well as a frig containing several free bottles of water. On the second night since we booked late he offered us two single rooms, both of which were clean and extremely nice. Since the b and b is a ways from the train station Daniel's girlfriend picked us up at the train station. Daniel really cares about his guests and on at least four occasions over two days he offered to drive us to various locations in town.
reviews.title: Small Acts of Kindness Make This Fabulous B and B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfasts are excellent. Each morning there were at least five different cakes to choose from, cold cuts, cereal, fresh fruit, orange juice, and a selection of hot beverages. Everything was delicious.
reviews.title: Delightful B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Daniele was constantly available to answer questions about Orvieto. He even loaned me one of his laptop computers to use since I did not bring mine to Italy.
reviews.title: Just One Night...

reviews.text: The price of this b and b is indeed a bargain compared to the other ten I stayed at while in Italy. if you choose to stay at this b and b please book your room directly from their web site.
reviews.title: Definitely coming back to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights in April. Danielle and the Villa did not disappoint. We arrived after dark and wanted to go into town for dinner but didn't want to drive, not knowing the town. After helping carry our very heavy bags to the 3rd floor and asking if we wanted a cold drink, Danielle offered to drive us 'up the hill' to Restaurant Mezza Luna. Everything at the b&b was spotless and comfortable. Breakfast was more than adequate and Orvieto was charming. Danielle suggested a side trip to Bagno Reggio and it was worth the little drive. Note, if you're not used to walking up hills, take your car and park in a designated lot when going into town.
reviews.title: The best B&B of our trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were complimenting the owner on the hotel's refurbishment, when he informed us that the building is modern. It is built to look old and it fooled us!
reviews.title: Modern building built to look old

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owners provided transportation from the train station (and into town one night when it was raining) for free. We loved our views from our room on the top floor. The room was big, comfortable, clean, and with fully modern plumbing.
reviews.title: Modern, Clean, Convenient Outstanding Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owner made us tea one afternoon and we had a lengthy conversation. It was very interesting for us to hear the local's point of view of politics and other topics. We really valued this interaction; we didn't get this type of dialog when we talked to front desk staff of hotels.
reviews.title: Perfect location, friendly people, great views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast had wonderful cakes/pies (in addition to the normal fare). The one consisting mainly of nuts was fantastic - make it a point to try the nutty pie.
reviews.title: Could not have been better
Wonderful place to stay
reviews.text: There is only one slight downside to staying here if you don't have a car. The walk into town is not far, but the road does not have a side walk. It's not a relaxing walk in the dark.
